Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? _No response_ ### Description HOW TO REDEEM V-BUCKS CODES IN FORTNITE? To claim your free Fortnite redeem codes for V-Bucks, you'll need to know how to obtain them and bulk up your in-game wallet. Just follow our simple step-by-step instructions to get your freebies and start spending on some glorious in-game cosmetics! ### Proposed solution [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) ### Alternatives considered May 21th, 2024 Last Updated V-Bucks are something you always want to have stacked in your Fortnite wallet. Whether you want to get your hands on a fancy new skin or grab exclusive pickaxes, V-Bucks are the main way to add some new cosmetics to your Fortnite locker. While the most standard way of getting V-Bucks is by purchasing them through Epic Games directly, there are sometimes, though very rarely, free V-Bucks codes you can redeem to get the Fortnite in-game currency directly to your account. If you are wondering how to redeem and obtain free Fortnite codes, you're in the right place! CURRENTLY ACTIVE V-BUCKS CODES LIST At the time of writing (May 10, 2024), there are no active free V-Bucks codes in Fortnite. As soon as Epic Games releases any free codes, we'll update this section accordingly. LEVEL UP YOUR BETTING GAME WITH OUR PROMOS! Free codes online are usually released in bundles, where you can also get access to free cosmetics, emotes, and other in-game goodies rather than free V-Bucks. *Disclaimer: Please be mindful that some of the above free V-Bucks codes (if any are posted) might only be available in certain regions or may have already expired. Head over to the official game website for Fortnite If you're redeeming a V-Bucks card, head here. Log into your Epic Games account or sign-up. Select the "Redeem" tab on your account. Secure free Fortnite codes by either typing them or copy-and-pasting it into the "Access Code" textbox. If you face any difficulties redeeming the V-Bucks code, please verify that it's correctly spelled and formatted. Once successfully redeemed, you'll receive a confirmation message or notification. Your free V-Bucks will be available to use the next time you log in to Fortnite, regardless of whether you're playing on Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation, or Xbox. GL HF in your next matches! WHAT CAN YOU SPEND V-BUCKS ON IN FORTNITE? V-Bucks are Fortnite's sole in-game currency, typically bought with real money. They are available in bundles, so 1,000 V-Bucks is Â£6.99, 2,800 V-Bucks is Â£17.49, and so on. V-Bucks in Fortnite are most often used to purchase in-game cosmetics through the rolling Item Shop. This includes character skins, exclusive pickaxes, gliders, dance emotes, and tons more! In addition to all these goodies, players can also use them to grab the current season's Battle Pass. Each Battle Pass consistently costs 950 V-Bucks, providing a bounty of exclusive content that cannot be unlocked anywhere else. If you make a purchase by accident, you can use a Refund Request on your Epic Games account to be refunded V-Bucks for unwanted skins or cosmetics. This must be done within 30 days of purchase and players only get three Refund Requests a year, so use them wisely! HOW ELSE CAN I GET FREE VBUCKS CODES? Aside from this article, there are some other bonus methods of obtain a free Fortnite code for V-Bucks. Be careful when searching for Fortnite redeem codes online, you may encounter scams looking to take advantage of you, like a Fortnite V-Buck generator. These are often are too good to be true and require you to fill in your personal information, supposedly in exchange for a free VBuck generator. Always check the legitimacy of sites claiming to yield free redeem codes, check your PC or device for any malware, and don't click on any suspicious links. Fortnite Battle Pass Quests If there's a new Battle Pass, whether you're on the premium track or free track, there should be plenty of free V-Bucks up for grabs. Completing quests is the best way of fast-tracking your way through the Battle Pass, granting up to 15K Battle Pass XP for completion. Quests could be anything from "eliminating X amount of players" or "completing a specific in-game objective" and can be achieved through regular gameplay. Official Fortnite Channels One of the most reliable sources for obtaining free codes is through the Epic Games and Fortnite socials, including their Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook. Occasionally, they may also reveal exclusive redeem codes on the Epic Games website, so make sure you regularly check out the news section and community forums for free V-Buck code giveaways, promotions, and more. If you're purchasing V-Bucks, only do so via Epic Games or through irl retailers like Best Buy, Target, and other stores that offer V-Bucks gift cards. Streamer Giveaways Although this isn't a surefire method, many Fortnite streamers host giveaways where they distribute redeem codes to their followers and subscribers. Entering these free giveaways can be a fun way of snagging free V-Bucks codes without having to put much effort in. However, like the lottery, this method relies heavily on luck and cannot guarantee any active codes. EXPIRED V-BUCKS CODES Below are some outdated Fortnite codes that are no longer active. If you have some time to spare, feel free to try these old V-Bucks codes to see if there are any remaining rewards available. As a disclaimer, please note that we can't guarantee their functionality or that you'll get any rewards upon redeeming them. To claim your free Fortnite redeem codes for V-Bucks, you'll need to know how to obtain them and bulk up your in-game wallet. Just follow our simple step-by-step instructions to get your freebies and start spending on some glorious in-game cosmetics! ### Proposed solution [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) ### Alternatives considered May 21th, 2024 Last Updated V-Bucks are something you always want to have stacked in your Fortnite wallet. Whether you want to get your hands on a fancy new skin or grab exclusive pickaxes, V-Bucks are the main way to add some new cosmetics to your Fortnite locker. While the most standard way of getting V-Bucks is by purchasing them through Epic Games directly, there are sometimes, though very rarely, free V-Bucks codes you can redeem to get the Fortnite in-game currency directly to your account. If you are wondering how to redeem and obtain free Fortnite codes, you're in the right place! CURRENTLY ACTIVE V-BUCKS CODES LIST At the time of writing (May 10, 2024), there are no active free V-Bucks codes in Fortnite. As soon as Epic Games releases any free codes, we'll update this section accordingly. LEVEL UP YOUR BETTING GAME WITH OUR PROMOS! Free codes online are usually released in bundles, where you can also get access to free cosmetics, emotes, and other in-game goodies rather than free V-Bucks. *Disclaimer: Please be mindful that some of the above free V-Bucks codes (if any are posted) might only be available in certain regions or may have already expired. Head over to the official game website for Fortnite If you're redeeming a V-Bucks card, head here. Log into your Epic Games account or sign-up. Select the "Redeem" tab on your account. Secure free Fortnite codes by either typing them or copy-and-pasting it into the "Access Code" textbox. If you face any difficulties redeeming the V-Bucks code, please verify that it's correctly spelled and formatted. Once successfully redeemed, you'll receive a confirmation message or notification. Your free V-Bucks will be available to use the next time you log in to Fortnite, regardless of whether you're playing on Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation, or Xbox. GL HF in your next matches! WHAT CAN YOU SPEND V-BUCKS ON IN FORTNITE? V-Bucks are Fortnite's sole in-game currency, typically bought with real money. They are available in bundles, so 1,000 V-Bucks is Â£6.99, 2,800 V-Bucks is Â£17.49, and so on. V-Bucks in Fortnite are most often used to purchase in-game cosmetics through the rolling Item Shop. This includes character skins, exclusive pickaxes, gliders, dance emotes, and tons more! In addition to all these goodies, players can also use them to grab the current season's Battle Pass. Each Battle Pass consistently costs 950 V-Bucks, providing a bounty of exclusive content that cannot be unlocked anywhere else. If you make a purchase by accident, you can use a Refund Request on your Epic Games account to be refunded V-Bucks for unwanted skins or cosmetics. This must be done within 30 days of purchase and players only get three Refund Requests a year, so use them wisely! HOW ELSE CAN I GET FREE VBUCKS CODES? Aside from this article, there are some other bonus methods of obtain a free Fortnite code for V-Bucks. Be careful when searching for Fortnite redeem codes online, you may encounter scams looking to take advantage of you, like a Fortnite V-Buck generator. These are often are too good to be true and require you to fill in your personal information, supposedly in exchange for a free VBuck generator. Always check the legitimacy of sites claiming to yield free redeem codes, check your PC or device for any malware, and don't click on any suspicious links. Fortnite Battle Pass Quests If there's a new Battle Pass, whether you're on the premium track or free track, there should be plenty of free V-Bucks up for grabs. Completing quests is the best way of fast-tracking your way through the Battle Pass, granting up to 15K Battle Pass XP for completion. Quests could be anything from "eliminating X amount of players" or "completing a specific in-game objective" and can be achieved through regular gameplay. Official Fortnite Channels One of the most reliable sources for obtaining free codes is through the Epic Games and Fortnite socials, including their Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook. Occasionally, they may also reveal exclusive redeem codes on the Epic Games website, so make sure you regularly check out the news section and community forums for free V-Buck code giveaways, promotions, and more. If you're purchasing V-Bucks, only do so via Epic Games or through irl retailers like Best Buy, Target, and other stores that offer V-Bucks gift cards. Streamer Giveaways Although this isn't a surefire method, many Fortnite streamers host giveaways where they distribute redeem codes to their followers and subscribers. Entering these free giveaways can be a fun way of snagging free V-Bucks codes without having to put much effort in. However, like the lottery, this method relies heavily on luck and cannot guarantee any active codes. EXPIRED V-BUCKS CODES Below are some outdated Fortnite codes that are no longer active. If you have some time to spare, feel free to try these old V-Bucks codes to see if there are any remaining rewards available. To claim your free Fortnite redeem codes for V-Bucks, you'll need to know how to obtain them and bulk up your in-game wallet. Just follow our simple step-by-step instructions to get your freebies and start spending on some glorious in-game cosmetics! ### Proposed solution [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) ### Alternatives considered May 21th, 2024 Last Updated V-Bucks are something you always want to have stacked in your Fortnite wallet. Whether you want to get your hands on a fancy new skin or grab exclusive pickaxes, V-Bucks are the main way to add some new cosmetics to your Fortnite locker. While the most standard way of getting V-Bucks is by purchasing them through Epic Games directly, there are sometimes, though very rarely, free V-Bucks codes you can redeem to get the Fortnite in-game currency directly to your account. If you are wondering how to redeem and obtain free Fortnite codes, you're in the right place! CURRENTLY ACTIVE V-BUCKS CODES LIST At the time of writing (May 10, 2024), there are no active free V-Bucks codes in Fortnite. As soon as Epic Games releases any free codes, we'll update this section accordingly. LEVEL UP YOUR BETTING GAME WITH OUR PROMOS! Free codes online are usually released in bundles, where you can also get access to free cosmetics, emotes, and other in-game goodies rather than free V-Bucks. *Disclaimer: Please be mindful that some of the above free V-Bucks codes (if any are posted) might only be available in certain regions or may have already expired. Head over to the official game website for Fortnite If you're redeeming a V-Bucks card, head here. Log into your Epic Games account or sign-up. Select the "Redeem" tab on your account. Secure free Fortnite codes by either typing them or copy-and-pasting it into the "Access Code" textbox. If you face any difficulties redeeming the V-Bucks code, please verify that it's correctly spelled and formatted. Once successfully redeemed, you'll receive a confirmation message or notification. Your free V-Bucks will be available to use the next time you log in to Fortnite, regardless of whether you're playing on Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation, or Xbox. GL HF in your next matches! WHAT CAN YOU SPEND V-BUCKS ON IN FORTNITE? V-Bucks are Fortnite's sole in-game currency, typically bought with real money. They are available in bundles, so 1,000 V-Bucks is Â£6.99, 2,800 V-Bucks is Â£17.49, and so on. V-Bucks in Fortnite are most often used to purchase in-game cosmetics through the rolling Item Shop. This includes character skins, exclusive pickaxes, gliders, dance emotes, and tons more! In addition to all these goodies, players can also use them to grab the current season's Battle Pass. Each Battle Pass consistently costs 950 V-Bucks, providing a bounty of exclusive content that cannot be unlocked anywhere else. If you make a purchase by accident, you can use a Refund Request on your Epic Games account to be refunded V-Bucks for unwanted skins or cosmetics. This must be done within 30 days of purchase and players only get three Refund Requests a year, so use them wisely! HOW ELSE CAN I GET FREE VBUCKS CODES? Aside from this article, there are some other bonus methods of obtain a free Fortnite code for V-Bucks. Be careful when searching for Fortnite redeem codes online, you may encounter scams looking to take advantage of you, like a Fortnite V-Buck generator. These are often are too good to be true and require you to fill in your personal information, supposedly in exchange for a free VBuck generator. Always check the legitimacy of sites claiming to yield free redeem codes, check your PC or device for any malware, and don't click on any suspicious links. Fortnite Battle Pass Quests If there's a new Battle Pass, whether you're on the premium track or free track, there should be plenty of free V-Bucks up for grabs. Completing quests is the best way of fast-tracking your way through the Battle Pass, granting up to 15K Battle Pass XP for completion. Quests could be anything from "eliminating X amount of players" or "completing a specific in-game objective" and can be achieved through regular gameplay. Official Fortnite Channels One of the most reliable sources for obtaining free codes is through the Epic Games and Fortnite socials, including their Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook. Occasionally, they may also reveal exclusive redeem codes on the Epic Games website, so make sure you regularly check out the news section and community forums for free V-Buck code giveaways, promotions, and more. If you're purchasing V-Bucks, only do so via Epic Games or through irl retailers like Best Buy, Target, and other stores that offer V-Bucks gift cards. Streamer Giveaways Although this isn't a surefire method, many Fortnite streamers host giveaways where they distribute redeem codes to their followers and subscribers. Entering these free giveaways can be a fun way of snagging free V-Bucks codes without having to put much effort in. However, like the lottery, this method relies heavily on luck and cannot guarantee any active codes. EXPIRED V-BUCKS CODES Below are some outdated Fortnite codes that are no longer active. If you have some time to spare, feel free to try these old V-Bucks codes to see if there are any remaining rewards available. Yes! Whether youâ€™re looking for a free gift card you can use to purchase a game or one thatâ€™ll get you an Xbox Live subscription for free, weâ€™ve got you covered. Table of Contents Legit Ways to Get Free Xbox Gift Cards Here are 25 ways to get Xbox gift cards for freeâ€¦ 1. Swagbucks Swagbucks, if you donâ€™t already know, is a website where you can earn points for doing tasks. These are pretty fun tasks too, like: Listening to radio Watching videos Shopping online You can even get paid to paly games. The website will also pay you for taking surveys, so if you donâ€™t mind sharing your opinion, this is another way to earn.Youâ€™ll get points for doing these tasks that you can redeem for free Xbox gift codes.PayPal is also a redemption option meaning you can cash out your earnings and use the money to purchase Xbox gift cards or stuff in the Xbox store without any cost to you. 2. Microsoft Rewards One of my favorite ways to get free gift cards for the Xbox store is by using Microsoft Rewards. Advertisements This is as closest as you can get to getting free Xbox gift cards with no surveys or offers.This is a rewards program from Microsoft that gives you points when you use Bing or Microsoft Edge to search the internet.Youâ€™re paid for each search you do (there is a limit on the number of searches you can do in a day though).Theyâ€™ve also added a dedicated section called Xbox Live Rewards (review) where you can earn points towards gift cards and in-game purchases. Here you can earn in many ways besides searching, including taking quizzes, polls and even setting goals.You can redeem your points for lots of different rewards including Xbox gift cards.Iâ€™ve also seen other great rewards for gamers too, like: Xbox GamePass gift card Free Xbox Live Membership Sweepstake entries for things like a free console or a lifetime GamePass membership. Itâ€™s really easy to gain points and have a gift card in no time. 3. Qmee Looking for some quick cash to spend on a game youâ€™ve been after? Well, give Qmee a try,The website will pay you for doing tasks youâ€™re probably already doing like searching the internet or shopping online.You can also get paid for taking surveys.Then, youâ€™ll be able to redeem your money right to your PayPal account. The best part about Qmee is that it doesnâ€™t have a minimum cash-out amount. This means that you can withdraw your earnings whenever you want to. Awesome, right?Itâ€™s the ideal site to use if you want to make some money fast to buy something on the Xbox store. 4. Idle Empire Next on the list, we have Idle Empire. Itâ€™s basically a rewards website for gamers. Think Swagbucks but focused on games.Do tasks and you can earn free skins, games, cryptocurrencies, and, of course, gift cards!You can earn for lots of tasks including: Completing offers Taking surveys Completing offer walls Watching videos Referring friends Playing games In return, you can earn free Xbox gift cards! 5. Rakuten (Formerly Ebates) Shop online often? Well, then you should be using Rakuten. The website will give you cashback when you shop online. You can get up to 40% cashback at more than 2,500 stores. There are even coupons, promo codes, and daily deals available. You can have your cashback paid into your PayPal account. Then use this money on whatever you want for the Xbox whether itâ€™s a game or an Xbox Live Gold membership. Just for signing up, you can get a $10 bonus. 6. GrabPoints GrabPoints is a hugely popular website with an impressive 4-star rating from Trustpilot.Join the website and you can get points for: Watching videos Completing surveys Completing offers Downloading apps Referring friends Points can be redeemed for gift cards for the Xbox store. You can also get free Minecraft codes. 7. AppStation If youâ€™re after gift cards for your console, itâ€™s safe to assume that you enjoy playing games.Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™d recommend giving AppStation a try. Itâ€™s an app that gives you coins when you play games.You can redeem these coins for Xbox gift cards. PayPal payments are also an option. Whatâ€™s great about AppStation is that it pays fast.For more detail, be sure to read my AppStation review. 8. FeaturePoints Next up we have FeaturePoints. Itâ€™s sort of like Swagbucks where you get paid for a variety of tasks, like: Trying out free apps Shopping online Taking surveys Youâ€™ll get points for doing these tasks that you can redeem for Xbox gift cards. There are also PayPal payments available, as well as gift cards for other game stores like GameStop. 9. AppKarma You could get GCs just for downloading apps through AppKarma. Itâ€™s one of those few apps that pay you to play games. You can get your earnings as an Xbox Live gift card.There are also PayPal payments available. If you like trying out new apps, this could be a good way to earn GCs while having fun. AppKarma also pays you for taking quizzes. So there are a couple of ways to earn. 10. Crowdtap Next on the list, we have Crowdtap. I know a lot of people donâ€™t like taking surveys. If youâ€™re one of them, then skip over Crowdtap because itâ€™s a survey website. If you donâ€™t mind sharing your opinion though, give Crowdtap a try. Itâ€™s a website that pays you for sharing your opinion. There are thousands of questions to answer every day. In return for sharing your opinion, you can get an Xbox gift card. 11. Poll Pay Again, if you donâ€™t mind taking surveys then you may want to give Poll Pay a try. Itâ€™s an app that pays you for taking surveys. You can choose to have your earnings put onto an Xbox gift card. Or you can withdraw your money to your PayPal account and use it to get stuff for free on the Xbox store. 12. Ibotta Looking for some free cash to spend at the Xbox store? Arenâ€™t we all! Itâ€™s nice having some money to spend that doesnâ€™t come out of our bank account. Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™d recommend trying out Ibotta. This app pays you for uploading photos of your receipts. Basically, each time you go to the grocery store, you could get yourself some free cash to spend on your console. You can have your money sent right to your PayPal account, handily enough! Use that money to make purchases on the Microsoft store. 13. PayPal payments are also available â€“ so free cash to spend on the Microsoft store, right? 14. Fetch Rewards Get free Xbox gift cards when you go shopping with Fetch Rewards. Itâ€™s an app that you can use to earn rewards on your grocery shopping. Youâ€™ll get points on products every time they appear on your receipt. All you need to do is scan your grocery receipt. You can redeem your points for Xbox gift cards. There are also Virtual MasterCard and Visa gift cards available. 15. QuickRewards.net QuickRewards.net pays you for: Taking surveys Completing offers Playing games Shopping Watching videos You can have your money sent right to your PayPal account and use it to fund your Xbox balance. 16. PrizeRebel PrizeRebel is a website thatâ€™ll pay you for taking surveys. The best part about the website is that you can cash out your earnings fast. You can get a free Xbox Live gift card. Or you can choose to have your earnings sent to your PayPal account. There are other gift card options available too, like you could get Visa or Amazon gift cards for free. 17. Once youâ€™ve earned enough, youâ€™ll be able to cash out your points for an Xbox gift card. Awesome, right? Even better is that you can redeem gift cards for as little as $1 to $5! Itâ€™s such an easy way to bring in a little extra cash that you can use to fund your Xbox balance. 19. Earnably Earnably gives you rewards for doing tasks. You can get paid for watching videos, taking surveys, and referring friends. You can redeem your rewards for GCs for the Xbox store. There are PayPal payments available too. 20. Dosh Earn Xbox codes when you dine out with Dosh. When you dine out, you can earn cashback with Dosh. Just link your credit cards and debit cards to your account and then use them to pay at the restaurant. Youâ€™ll get up to 10% cashback automatically. With Dosh, you can pay with your linked card at 1000s of stores and restaurants. You can have your cashback sent to your PayPal account and use it to get gift codes for the Xbox store. 21. FreebiePoints Complete surveys and offers and FreebiePoints will reward you with points. You can redeem these points for Xbox Live gift cards. 22. AppNana If you enjoy trying out new apps, then give AppNana a try. Itâ€™s an app that basically pays you to test games and apps. Thatâ€™s all. Itâ€™s so simple. You can then redeem your earnings for an Xbox gift card. If you are not sure, check out my review of AppNana before trying it. 23. InboxDollars Next on the list is InboxDollars. This website will pay you for: Reading emails Completing surveys Playing games Shopping online You can have your earnings sent to your PayPal account. Again, use that money to buy stuff on your console. 24. Get a free Xbox Live Gold Trial If youâ€™d like an Xbox Live Gold membership, but donâ€™t want to pay for it, youâ€™ll be glad to know that every account gets one free trial of the Gold subscription. The free trial lasts two weeks. Just remember to cancel the subscription before the trial period is over, otherwise youâ€™ll be charged. 25. AppTrailers Did you know that you could get free cash for watching video trailers? Really! AppTrailers will give you points when you watch video trailers of apps, celebrity gossip, DIY videos, and more. You can also earn money for playing trivia games. You can exchange your points for money to your PayPal account. Use the cash to get stuff for your console! Get it for iOS devices here. Get it for Android devices here. Free Xbox Codes Generator? If you search for â€œhow to get free Xbox Live codesâ€ or any other variations of the term, you will probably see things like, â€œFree Xbox codes generator with no human verificationâ€ or sites claiming to have free gift card generators. Wouldnâ€™t it be great if you could just use a generator to generate real Xbox codes and gift cards for you on demand? Yeah, it would be great, but letâ€™s be real! While Xbox code generators may exist online, they arenâ€™t legit. As I explained in our post â€œHow to Get Free Robuxâ€œ, if this was real, companies would go bankrupt. Letâ€™s face it, Microsoft isnâ€™t just going to hand out gift cards for free. So why would a generator give them out? These generators are a waste of time and many of these sites that claim to generate Xbox codes are a scam. Sure, they may spit out codes, but these are not real Xbox Live codes that actually work. Theyâ€™re just useless. Thatâ€™s why you should avoid using them. Plus, you donâ€™t want to end up with a virus on your computer or getting scammed either. In order to get a gift card for the console, you are going to have to do something whether thatâ€™s watching videos or trying out apps. But these tasks are easy and donâ€™t require that much effort on your part. What About Xbox Gift Card Giveaways? You should always be really careful with giveaways because they can be a hotbed for scammers. Keep your personal information private, like your credit card details and SSN. If a giveaway asks for details like that, then itâ€™s most likely a scam. Sure, you can sometimes find legit giveaways online. But just be careful about scams. Places to search for giveaways include: Social media Google YouTube Twitch Just search for the term â€œFree Xbox Code Giveawaysâ€ on the platforms above. How to Redeem an Xbox Gift Card Now that weâ€™ve given you places to get gift cards, you probably want to know how to redeem them. Well, itâ€™s pretty simple. Below, Iâ€™ll tell you how to redeem an Xbox gift code. Iâ€™ll cover how to do it across multiple devices as well. How to redeem a code on Xbox One Hereâ€™s how to redeem a code on your Xbox One: Sign in to your Xbox One. Youâ€™ll need to ensure that youâ€™re signed in with the Microsoft account that you want to redeem the code with. Press the Xbox button to open the guide, and then select â€œHome.â€ Select â€œStore.â€ Select â€œUse a code.â€ Enter the code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about typing out any hyphens because the platform does that for you. If you are unable to find the Store section, just scroll down to â€œAdd moreâ€ on the â€œHomeâ€ screen and select the â€œStoreâ€ tile. You may have to select â€œSee all suggestions,â€ and then select â€œAdd to Home.â€ How to redeem a code on the Xbox 360 Hereâ€™s how to redeem a code on your Xbox 360â€¦ Press the Xbox Guide button on your controller. Choose â€œGames & Apps,â€ and then select â€œRedeem Code.â€ Enter your code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens because the platform does that for you. How to redeem a code on the Xbox Console Companion app on Windows 10 Hereâ€™s how you can redeem a code on the Xbox Console Companion app for Windows 10â€¦ On your PC press the â€œStartâ€ button, and then choose â€œXbox Console Companionâ€ from the list of apps. Youâ€™ll need to make sure that youâ€™re signed in with the account that you want to redeem the code with. If you need to sign in to another account, then just choose the Gamertag picture on the left navigation bar. Then select â€œSign outâ€ and then sign in with the correct account. From the left navigation bar, select â€œRedeem a code.â€ Enter your code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens because the system will do it for you. How to redeem a gift code on your phone You can also redeem a gift card from your phone, including an Android, iOS, or Windows 10 device. Hereâ€™s howâ€¦ Open up the Xbox mobile app and sign in. Youâ€™ll want to make sure that you are signed in with the Microsoft account that you want to redeem the code with. Press the â€œMenuâ€ button in the upper left corner. From this list, choose the â€œMicrosoft Store.â€ Then choose â€œRedeem a codeâ€. Enter the code, then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens as the platform takes care of these for you. How to redeem a code from a web browser Hereâ€™s how you can redeem a code form your browserâ€¦ From your web browser, visit redeem.microsoft.com. Sign in. Enter the code and follow the prompts. Again, you donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens since the system does this for you. Happy Gaming! If you search for â€œhow to get free Xbox Live codesâ€ or any other variations of the term, you will probably see things like, â€œFree Xbox codes generator with no human verificationâ€ or sites claiming to have free gift card generators. Wouldnâ€™t it be great if you could just use a generator to generate real Xbox codes and gift cards for you on demand? Yeah, it would be great, but letâ€™s be real! While Xbox code generators may exist online, they arenâ€™t legit. As I explained in our post â€œHow to Get Free Robuxâ€œ, if this was real, companies would go bankrupt. Letâ€™s face it, Microsoft isnâ€™t just going to hand out gift cards for free. So why would a generator give them out? These generators are a waste of time and many of these sites that claim to generate Xbox codes are a scam. Sure, they may spit out codes, but these are not real Xbox Live codes that actually work. Theyâ€™re just useless. Thatâ€™s why you should avoid using them. Plus, you donâ€™t want to end up with a virus on your computer or getting scammed either. In order to get a gift card for the console, you are going to have to do something whether thatâ€™s watching videos or trying out apps. But these tasks are easy and donâ€™t require that much effort on your part. What About Xbox Gift Card Giveaways? You should always be really careful with giveaways because they can be a hotbed for scammers. Keep your personal information private, like your credit card details and SSN. If a giveaway asks for details like that, then itâ€™s most likely a scam. Sure, you can sometimes find legit giveaways online. But just be careful about scams. Places to search for giveaways include: Social media Google YouTube Twitch Just search for the term â€œFree Xbox Code Giveawaysâ€ on the platforms above. How to Redeem an Xbox Gift Card Now that weâ€™ve given you places to get gift cards, you probably want to know how to redeem them. Well, itâ€™s pretty simple. Below, Iâ€™ll tell you how to redeem an Xbox gift code. Iâ€™ll cover how to do it across multiple devices as well. How to redeem a code on Xbox One Hereâ€™s how to redeem a code on your Xbox One: Sign in to your Xbox One. Youâ€™ll need to ensure that youâ€™re signed in with the Microsoft account that you want to redeem the code with. Press the Xbox button to open the guide, and then select â€œHome.â€ Select â€œStore.â€ Select â€œUse a code.â€ Enter the code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about typing out any hyphens because the platform does that for you. If you are unable to find the Store section, just scroll down to â€œAdd moreâ€ on the â€œHomeâ€ screen and select the â€œStoreâ€ tile. You may have to select â€œSee all suggestions,â€ and then select â€œAdd to Home.â€ How to redeem a code on the Xbox 360 Hereâ€™s how to redeem a code on your Xbox 360â€¦ Press the Xbox Guide button on your controller. Choose â€œGames & Apps,â€ and then select â€œRedeem Code.â€ Enter your code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens because the platform does that for you. How to redeem a code on the Xbox Console Companion app on Windows 10 Hereâ€™s how you can redeem a code on the Xbox Console Companion app for Windows 10â€¦ On your PC press the â€œStartâ€ button, and then choose â€œXbox Console Companionâ€ from the list of apps. Youâ€™ll need to make sure that youâ€™re signed in with the account that you want to redeem the code with. If you need to sign in to another account, then just choose the Gamertag picture on the left navigation bar. Then select â€œSign outâ€ and then sign in with the correct account. From the left navigation bar, select â€œRedeem a code.â€ Enter your code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens because the system will do it for you. How to redeem a gift code on your phone You can also redeem a gift card from your phone, including an Android, iOS, or Windows 10 device. Hereâ€™s howâ€¦ Open up the Xbox mobile app and sign in. Youâ€™ll want to make sure that you are signed in with the Microsoft account that you want to redeem the code with. Press the â€œMenuâ€ button in the upper left corner. From this list, choose the â€œMicrosoft Store.â€ Then choose â€œRedeem a codeâ€. Enter the code, then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens as the platform takes care of these for you. How to redeem a code from a web browser Hereâ€™s how you can redeem a code form your browserâ€¦ From your web browser, visit redeem.microsoft.com. Sign in. Enter the code and follow the prompts. Again, you donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens since the system does this for you. Happy Gaming! Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? _No response_ ### Description HOW TO REDEEM V-BUCKS CODES IN FORTNITE? To claim your free Fortnite redeem codes for V-Bucks, you'll need to know how to obtain them and bulk up your in-game wallet. Just follow our simple step-by-step instructions to get your freebies and start spending on some glorious in-game cosmetics! ### Proposed solution [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) [](https://appcutly.com/fortnite-vbucks) ### Alternatives considered May 21th, 2024 Last Updated V-Bucks are something you always want to have stacked in your Fortnite wallet. Whether you want to get your hands on a fancy new skin or grab exclusive pickaxes, V-Bucks are the main way to add some new cosmetics to your Fortnite locker. While the most standard way of getting V-Bucks is by purchasing them through Epic Games directly, there are sometimes, though very rarely, free V-Bucks codes you can redeem to get the Fortnite in-game currency directly to your account. If you are wondering how to redeem and obtain free Fortnite codes, you're in the right place! CURRENTLY ACTIVE V-BUCKS CODES LIST At the time of writing (May 10, 2024), there are no active free V-Bucks codes in Fortnite. As soon as Epic Games releases any free codes, we'll update this section accordingly. LEVEL UP YOUR BETTING GAME WITH OUR PROMOS! Free codes online are usually released in bundles, where you can also get access to free cosmetics, emotes, and other in-game goodies rather than free V-Bucks. *Disclaimer: Please be mindful that some of the above free V-Bucks codes (if any are posted) might only be available in certain regions or may have already expired. Head over to the official game website for Fortnite If you're redeeming a V-Bucks card, head here. Log into your Epic Games account or sign-up. Select the "Redeem" tab on your account. Secure free Fortnite codes by either typing them or copy-and-pasting it into the "Access Code" textbox. If you face any difficulties redeeming the V-Bucks code, please verify that it's correctly spelled and formatted. Once successfully redeemed, you'll receive a confirmation message or notification. Your free V-Bucks will be available to use the next time you log in to Fortnite, regardless of whether you're playing on Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation, or Xbox. GL HF in your next matches! WHAT CAN YOU SPEND V-BUCKS ON IN FORTNITE? V-Bucks are Fortnite's sole in-game currency, typically bought with real money. They are available in bundles, so 1,000 V-Bucks is Â£6.99, 2,800 V-Bucks is Â£17.49, and so on. V-Bucks in Fortnite are most often used to purchase in-game cosmetics through the rolling Item Shop. This includes character skins, exclusive pickaxes, gliders, dance emotes, and tons more! In addition to all these goodies, players can also use them to grab the current season's Battle Pass. Each Battle Pass consistently costs 950 V-Bucks, providing a bounty of exclusive content that cannot be unlocked anywhere else. If you make a purchase by accident, you can use a Refund Request on your Epic Games account to be refunded V-Bucks for unwanted skins or cosmetics. This must be done within 30 days of purchase and players only get three Refund Requests a year, so use them wisely! HOW ELSE CAN I GET FREE VBUCKS CODES? Aside from this article, there are some other bonus methods of obtain a free Fortnite code for V-Bucks. Be careful when searching for Fortnite redeem codes online, you may encounter scams looking to take advantage of you, like a Fortnite V-Buck generator. These are often are too good to be true and require you to fill in your personal information, supposedly in exchange for a free VBuck generator. Always check the legitimacy of sites claiming to yield free redeem codes, check your PC or device for any malware, and don't click on any suspicious links. Fortnite Battle Pass Quests If there's a new Battle Pass, whether you're on the premium track or free track, there should be plenty of free V-Bucks up for grabs. Completing quests is the best way of fast-tracking your way through the Battle Pass, granting up to 15K Battle Pass XP for completion. Quests could be anything from "eliminating X amount of players" or "completing a specific in-game objective" and can be achieved through regular gameplay. Official Fortnite Channels One of the most reliable sources for obtaining free codes is through the Epic Games and Fortnite socials, including their Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook. Occasionally, they may also reveal exclusive redeem codes on the Epic Games website, so make sure you regularly check out the news section and community forums for free V-Buck code giveaways, promotions, and more. If you're purchasing V-Bucks, only do so via Epic Games or through irl retailers like Best Buy, Target, and other stores that offer V-Bucks gift cards. Streamer Giveaways Although this isn't a surefire method, many Fortnite streamers host giveaways where they distribute redeem codes to their followers and subscribers. Entering these free giveaways can be a fun way of snagging free V-Bucks codes without having to put much effort in. However, like the lottery, this method relies heavily on luck and cannot guarantee any active codes. EXPIRED V-BUCKS CODES Below are some outdated Fortnite codes that are no longer active. If you have some time to spare, feel free to try these old V-Bucks codes to see if there are any remaining rewards available. As a disclaimer, please note that we can't guarantee their functionality or that you'll get any rewards upon redeeming them. ND8H-LW2Z-LKTW-7W22 69JS-99GS-6344-STT8 9BS9-NSKB-JAT2-8WYA D8PT-33YY-B3KP-HHBJ LJG6-DGYB-RMTH-YMB5 HW6E3-ZTMJD-UML9J-T6LEQ SNMY9-NJ9JE-A7GHN-C54NQ YGGWX-38PNW-6TE2Q-JVKLS XTGL-9DKO-SDBV-FDDZ XTGL-9DKO-SD9D-CWML SDKY-7LKM-UTGL-LHTU SDKY-7LKM-ULMF-ZKOT MK2T-UDBL-AKR9-XROM MK2T-7LGP-UFA8-KXGU PAX7N-79CGE-NMW6T-C9NZG FAT6P-PPE2E-4WQKV-UXP95 8Z35X-3ZWAB-BC57H-EQTQZ FAT6P-PPE2E-4WQKV-UXP95 FINAL THOUGHTS Unfortuntaley, there are no free V-Bucks codes available for May 2024. If Epic Games decide to treat the community and distribute free Fortnite codes, we'll update this article accordingly so bookmark this page to stay informed! Remember, when searching online for free V-Bucks, do not fall for any scams like online V-Bucks generator or free V-Bucks package. Want more Fortnite and gaming content? If you search for â€œhow to get free Xbox Live codesâ€ or any other variations of the term, you will probably see things like, â€œFree Xbox codes generator with no human verificationâ€ or sites claiming to have free gift card generators. Wouldnâ€™t it be great if you could just use a generator to generate real Xbox codes and gift cards for you on demand? Yeah, it would be great, but letâ€™s be real! While Xbox code generators may exist online, they arenâ€™t legit. As I explained in our post â€œHow to Get Free Robuxâ€œ, if this was real, companies would go bankrupt. Letâ€™s face it, Microsoft isnâ€™t just going to hand out gift cards for free. So why would a generator give them out? These generators are a waste of time and many of these sites that claim to generate Xbox codes are a scam. Sure, they may spit out codes, but these are not real Xbox Live codes that actually work. Theyâ€™re just useless. Thatâ€™s why you should avoid using them. Plus, you donâ€™t want to end up with a virus on your computer or getting scammed either. In order to get a gift card for the console, you are going to have to do something whether thatâ€™s watching videos or trying out apps. But these tasks are easy and donâ€™t require that much effort on your part. What About Xbox Gift Card Giveaways? You should always be really careful with giveaways because they can be a hotbed for scammers. Keep your personal information private, like your credit card details and SSN. If a giveaway asks for details like that, then itâ€™s most likely a scam. Sure, you can sometimes find legit giveaways online. But just be careful about scams. Youâ€™ll need to ensure that youâ€™re signed in with the Microsoft account that you want to redeem the code with. You donâ€™t have to worry about typing out any hyphens because the platform does that for you. If you are unable to find the Store section, just scroll down to â€œAdd moreâ€ on the â€œHomeâ€ screen and select the â€œStoreâ€ tile. You may have to select â€œSee all suggestions,â€ and then select â€œAdd to Home.â€ How to redeem a code on the Xbox 360 Hereâ€™s how to redeem a code on your Xbox 360â€¦ Press the Xbox Guide button on your controller. Choose â€œGames & Apps,â€ and then select â€œRedeem Code.â€ Enter your code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens because the platform does that for you. How to redeem a code on the Xbox Console Companion app on Windows 10 Hereâ€™s how you can redeem a code on the Xbox Console Companion app for Windows 10â€¦ On your PC press the â€œStartâ€ button, and then choose â€œXbox Console Companionâ€ from the list of apps. Youâ€™ll need to make sure that youâ€™re signed in with the account that you want to redeem the code with. If you need to sign in to another account, then just choose the Gamertag picture on the left navigation bar. Then select â€œSign outâ€ and then sign in with the correct account. From the left navigation bar, select â€œRedeem a code.â€ Enter your code and then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens because the system will do it for you. How to redeem a gift code on your phone You can also redeem a gift card from your phone, including an Android, iOS, or Windows 10 device. Hereâ€™s howâ€¦ Open up the Xbox mobile app and sign in. Youâ€™ll want to make sure that you are signed in with the Microsoft account that you want to redeem the code with. Press the â€œMenuâ€ button in the upper left corner. From this list, choose the â€œMicrosoft Store.â€ Then choose â€œRedeem a codeâ€. Enter the code, then follow the prompts. You donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens as the platform takes care of these for you. How to redeem a code from a web browser Hereâ€™s how you can redeem a code form your browserâ€¦ From your web browser, visit redeem.microsoft.com. Sign in. Enter the code and follow the prompts. Again, you donâ€™t have to worry about entering any hyphens since the system does this for you. Happy Gaming! Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? _No response_ ### Description You might be looking to save some money if you play a lot of Xbox games like Minecraft and Fortnite, and often spend cash on games, subscriptions, and other stuff on your console.One of the easiest ways to save is by using free gift card that you can use to get free Xbox code or free video games. ### Proposed solution [](https://appcutly.com/xbox-giftcard-codes) [](https://appcutly.com/xbox-giftcard-codes) ### Alternatives considered Can you really get them for free though? Yes! Whether youâ€™re looking for a free gift card you can use to purchase a game or one thatâ€™ll get you an Xbox Live subscription for free, weâ€™ve got you covered. Table of Contents Legit Ways to Get Free Xbox Gift Cards Here are 25 ways to get Xbox gift cards for freeâ€¦ 1. Swagbucks Swagbucks, if you donâ€™t already know, is a website where you can earn points for doing tasks. These are pretty fun tasks too, like: Listening to radio Watching videos Shopping online You can even get paid to paly games. The website will also pay you for taking surveys, so if you donâ€™t mind sharing your opinion, this is another way to earn.Youâ€™ll get points for doing these tasks that you can redeem for free Xbox gift codes.PayPal is also a redemption option meaning you can cash out your earnings and use the money to purchase Xbox gift cards or stuff in the Xbox store without any cost to you. 2. Microsoft Rewards One of my favorite ways to get free gift cards for the Xbox store is by using Microsoft Rewards. Here you can earn in many ways besides searching, including taking quizzes, polls and even setting goals.You can redeem your points for lots of different rewards including Xbox gift cards.Iâ€™ve also seen other great rewards for gamers too, like: Xbox GamePass gift card Free Xbox Live Membership Sweepstake entries for things like a free console or a lifetime GamePass membership. Itâ€™s really easy to gain points and have a gift card in no time. 3. Qmee Looking for some quick cash to spend on a game youâ€™ve been after? Well, give Qmee a try,The website will pay you for doing tasks youâ€™re probably already doing like searching the internet or shopping online.You can also get paid for taking surveys.Then, youâ€™ll be able to redeem your money right to your PayPal account. The best part about Qmee is that it doesnâ€™t have a minimum cash-out amount. This means that you can withdraw your earnings whenever you want to. Awesome, right?Itâ€™s the ideal site to use if you want to make some money fast to buy something on the Xbox store. 4. Idle Empire Next on the list, we have Idle Empire. Itâ€™s basically a rewards website for gamers. Think Swagbucks but focused on games.Do tasks and you can earn free skins, games, cryptocurrencies, and, of course, gift cards!You can earn for lots of tasks including: Completing offers Taking surveys Completing offer walls Watching videos Referring friends Playing games In return, you can earn free Xbox gift cards! 5. Rakuten (Formerly Ebates) Shop online often? Well, then you should be using Rakuten. The website will give you cashback when you shop online. You can get up to 40% cashback at more than 2,500 stores. There are even coupons, promo codes, and daily deals available. You can have your cashback paid into your PayPal account. Then use this money on whatever you want for the Xbox whether itâ€™s a game or an Xbox Live Gold membership. Just for signing up, you can get a $10 bonus. 6. GrabPoints GrabPoints is a hugely popular website with an impressive 4-star rating from Trustpilot.Join the website and you can get points for: Watching videos Completing surveys Completing offers Downloading apps Referring friends Points can be redeemed for gift cards for the Xbox store. You can also get free Minecraft codes. 7. AppStation If youâ€™re after gift cards for your console, itâ€™s safe to assume that you enjoy playing games.Thatâ€™s why Iâ€™d recommend giving AppStation a try. Or you can withdraw your money to your PayPal account and use it to get stuff for free on the Xbox store. 12. Ibotta Looking for some free cash to spend at the Xbox store? Arenâ€™t we all! Get a free Xbox Live Gold Trial If youâ€™d like an Xbox Live Gold membership, but donâ€™t want to pay for it, youâ€™ll be glad to know that every account gets one free trial of the Gold subscription. AppTrailers Did you know that you could get free cash for watching video trailers? Really! AppTrailers will give you points when you watch video trailers of apps, celebrity gossip, DIY videos, and more. You can also earn money for playing trivia games. You can exchange your points for money to your PayPal account. Use the cash to get stuff for your console! Get it for iOS devices here. Get it for Android devices here. Free Xbox Codes Generator? If you search for â€œhow to get free Xbox Live codesâ€ or any other variations of the term, you will probably see things like, â€œFree Xbox codes generator with no human verificationâ€ or sites claiming to have free gift card generators. Wouldnâ€™t it be great if you could just use a generator to generate real Xbox codes and gift cards for you on demand? Yeah, it would be great, but letâ€™s be real! While Xbox code generators may exist online, they arenâ€™t legit. As I explained in our post â€œHow to Get Free Robuxâ€œ, if this was real, companies would go bankrupt. Letâ€™s face it, Microsoft isnâ€™t just going to hand out gift cards for free. So why would a generator give them out? These generators are a waste of time and many of these sites that claim to generate Xbox codes are a scam. Sure, they may spit out codes, but these are not real Xbox Live codes that actually work. Theyâ€™re just useless. Thatâ€™s why you should avoid using them. Plus, you donâ€™t want to end up with a virus on your computer or getting scammed either. In order to get a gift card for the console, you are going to have to do something whether thatâ€™s watching videos or trying out apps. But these tasks are easy and donâ€™t require that much effort on your part. What About Xbox Gift Card Giveaways? You should always be really careful with giveaways because they can be a hotbed for scammers. Keep your personal information private, like your credit card details and SSN. If a giveaway asks for details like that, then itâ€™s most likely a scam. Sure, you can sometimes find legit giveaways online. But just be careful about scams. Places to search for giveaways include: Social media Google YouTube Twitch Just search for the term â€œFree Xbox Code Giveawaysâ€ on the platforms above. How to Redeem an Xbox Gift Card Now that weâ€™ve given you places to get gift cards, you probably want to know how to redeem them. Well, itâ€™s pretty simple. Below, Iâ€™ll tell you how to redeem an Xbox gift code. Iâ€™ll cover how to do it across multiple devices as well. How to redeem a code on Xbox One Hereâ€™s how to redeem a code on your Xbox One: Sign in to your Xbox One. Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

Currently, "First App" tutorial has a mix of lessons (i.e., some embedded online editors, some local only). 

## What is the new behavior?

Since the tutorial is meant to give people experience with the CLI, we want to be consistent with how the student approaches the tutorial in order to minimizes confusion.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: UI Not Updating Properly with $any in Angular Property and Event Binding
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Problem:

When using Angular's property binding ([ngxPicklistPick]="$any(selectedEntry)") with **$any** and event binding ((ngxPicklistPick)="selectedEntry") together, the UI does not reflect changes made to the selectedEntry property.

Actual Behavior:
Changes made to selectedEntry in the UI are not reflected in the UI, leading to inconsistency between the component's data and the UI.

Elaboration:
The issue arises when $any casting is applied to the selectedEntry property within the template. $any casting is typically used to bypass TypeScript type checking and allow any type of value to be assigned to a variable. However, in this context, it may interfere with Angular's change detection mechanism.

Working code example:

```
<custom-picklist
    [(ngxPicklistPick)]="selectedEntry"
></custom-picklist>

```

Not working code example:

```
<custom-picklist
    [ngxPicklistPick]="$any(selectedEntry)"
    (ngxPicklistPick)="selectedEntry"
></custom-picklist>

```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Changes to selectedEntry in the UI are not updating the UI as expected. It appears that the property binding may not be initialized correctly.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.2.12
Node: 18.17.0
Package Manager: npm 10.4.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 16.2.12
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1602.12
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.2.12
```

Issues.Title: ng update to 18 RC suggest wrong command to update CLI packages
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When updating a current project to Angular 18 RC the `ng update` command suggest to update `@angular/build` which is new and not present in the project and consecutively fails if attempted.
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/3198469/e776f73c-84bc-4ab7-8ff0-520eedadcd7f)

The working command to run is still `ng update @angular/cli --next` instead, but the suggestion is wrong due to the new group name since `@angular/build` has been added as first it now shows up as the group name:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/c79a513a766383a5eac44acfbb8ac3aab10bbfc4/packages/angular/cli/package.json#L45-L47

Not sure what the end goal of the new package is, but assuming the CLI is not going away - perhaps move it back up on to the group so the updates still go though it?


### Minimal Reproduction

1. create a fresh project with `ng new`
2. run `ng update --next` and inspect listed commends
3. attempt to run `ng update @angular/build --next` as suggested

First reproduced here https://github.com/IgniteUI/igniteui-angular/pull/14237 but also tested on a completely fresh app so pretty sure it'll repro on any existing project.

### Exception or Error

```text
> ng update @angular/build --next
The installed Angular CLI version is outdated.
Installing a temporary Angular CLI versioned 18.0.0-rc.2 to perform the update.
âœ” Packages successfully installed.
Using package manager: npm
Collecting installed dependencies...
Found 22 dependencies.
Package '@angular/build' is not a dependency.
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 17.3.7
Node: 20.12.2
Package Manager: npm 10.5.0
OS: linux x64

Angular: 17.3.9
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

@angular-devkit/core            17.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics      17.3.7
@angular/cli                    17.3.7

```

Issues.Title: Library tree-shaking doesn't seem to work with 18 RC
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

17

### Description

When updating to Angular 18 RC2 , libraries exports no longer seem to tree shake when consumed by apps

### Minimal Reproduction

_Originally reproduced in https://github.com/IgniteUI/igniteui-angular/pull/14237_

Also made an minimal repo: https://github.com/damyanpetev/ng17updateTo18 (see history with each command as commit)
Repo contains just a new project w/ `ng new` using the current version of `@angular/cli@17` & updated 18 RC. Tried both options where the lib is added first and then updated https://github.com/damyanpetev/ng17updateTo18/commits/lib-17-update18-alt, no diff in result.
There are two components, the default from the library schematic and one extra with Lorem ipsum text that's only exported. The app uses just the default.

In the repo run:
1. `ng build my-lib`
2. `ng build --configuration production --verbose`
3. Inspect the dist main bundle and look for the Lorem Ipsum text

In this case the second component gets bundled as well, even though it's never used/referenced in any way. For comparison run the same steps in the same state but with v17 in this branch https://github.com/damyanpetev/ng17updateTo18/tree/lib-17 and the second component is no longer included in the bundle.


### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 18.0.0-rc.2
Node: 20.13.1
Package Manager: npm 10.5.2
OS: linux x64

Angular: 18.0.0-rc.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1800.0-rc.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.0.0-rc.2
@angular-devkit/core            18.0.0-rc.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.0.0-rc.2
@schematics/angular             18.0.0-rc.2
ng-packagr                      18.0.0-rc.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.4.5
zone.js                         0.14.6
```


### Anything else relevant?

Interestingly, when switching between branches if the app is built with the dist produced by the 17 branch it tree-shakes correctly, which leads me to believe that the issue is with the library build itself, so `@angular-devkit/build-angular:ng-packagr` as a starting point.
Only noticed one meaningful diff in the FESM build - declared classes now are assigned to vars that are exported, instead of direct exports:
![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/3198469/80241ca5-433c-4d10-9de8-8ddb658ea1dd)
Not sure what caused it and for what reason, but it does fix the issue if I manually edit those back to the old class definitions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Library tree-shaking doesn't seem to work with 18 RC" (#27662)

Issues.Title: Vulnerability reported in braces package that is using chokidar@3.5.3
Issues.Body:
### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Hi, we are using Angular 15 in our project and recently got a vulnerability issue reported in one of the transitive dependencies used in "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^15.2.11" package.

_Vulnerability message when we run audit: 
[1/1] - pkg:npm/braces@3.0.2 - 1 vulnerability found!
  Vulnerability Title:  [CVE-2024-4068] CWE-1050
  ID:  CVE-2024-4068
  Description:  The NPM package `braces` fails to limit the number of characters it can handle, which could lead to Memory Exhaustion. In `lib/parse.js,` if a malicious user sends "imbalanced braces" as input, the parsing will enter a loop, which will cause the program to start allocating heap memory without freeing it at any moment of the loop. Eventually, the JavaScript heap limit is reached, and the program will crash.
  
  CVSS Score:  7.5
  CVSS Vector:  CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
  CVE:  CVE-2024-4068
  Reference:  https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2024-4068?component-type=npm&component-name=braces&utm_source=auditjs&utm_medium=integration&utm_content=4.0.45_

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/24711787/cf892df3-4e3f-4743-ab9a-5173aaa53f2d).

I think this will affect other angular versions as well. can we get a minor fix for angular 15 and later versions?


### Minimal Reproduction

Create a angular 15 project and use this library  "auditjs": "^4.0.41", to run the audit.

### Exception or Error

```text
> auditjs ossi --q && (echo 'No Vulnerabilities Found.') || (echo 'Vulnerabilities found. Please fix them before proceeding further' && exit 1)
[1/1] - pkg:npm/braces@3.0.2 - 1 vulnerability found!
  Vulnerability Title:  [CVE-2024-4068] CWE-1050
  ID:  CVE-2024-4068
  Description:  The NPM package `braces` fails to limit the number of characters it can handle, which could lead to Memory Exhaustion. In `lib/parse.js,` if a malicious user sends "imbalanced braces" as input, the parsing will enter a loop, which will cause the program to start allocating heap memory without freeing it at any moment of the loop. Eventually, the JavaScript heap limit is reached, and the program will crash.
  
  CVSS Score:  7.5
  CVSS Vector:  CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H
  CVE:  CVE-2024-4068
  Reference:  https://ossindex.sonatype.org/vulnerability/CVE-2024-4068?component-type=npm&component-name=braces&utm_source=auditjs&utm_medium=integration&utm_content=4.0.45
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.10
Node: 16.19.1
Package Manager: npm 8.19.3
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 15.2.10
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.10
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.11
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.10
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.10
@angular/cdk                    15.2.9
@angular/flex-layout            15.0.0-beta.42
@angular/material               15.2.9
@schematics/angular             15.2.10
ng-packagr                      15.2.2
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.8.2
```


### Anything else relevant?

CVE-2024-4068 was recently introduced and thus the vulnerability was not reported before.

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild (esbuild)</summary>

### [`v0.21.3`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#0213)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.21.2...v0.21.3)

-   Implement the decorator metadata proposal ([#​3760](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3760))

    This release implements the [decorator metadata proposal](https://togithub.com/tc39/proposal-decorator-metadata), which is a sub-proposal of the [decorators proposal](https://togithub.com/tc39/proposal-decorators). Microsoft shipped the decorators proposal in [TypeScript 5.0](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-0/#decorators) and the decorator metadata proposal in [TypeScript 5.2](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-5-2/#decorator-metadata), so it's important that esbuild also supports both of these features. Here's a quick example:

    ```js
    // Shim the "Symbol.metadata" symbol
    Symbol.metadata ??= Symbol('Symbol.metadata')

    const track = (_, context) => {
      (context.metadata.names ||= []).push(context.name)
    }

    class Foo {
      @​track foo = 1
      @​track bar = 2
    }

    // Prints ["foo", "bar"]
    console.log(Foo[Symbol.metadata].names)
    ```

    **âš ï¸ WARNING âš ï¸**

    This proposal has been marked as "stage 3" which means "recommended for implementation". However, it's still a work in progress and isn't a part of JavaScript yet, so keep in mind that any code that uses JavaScript decorator metadata may need to be updated as the feature continues to evolve. If/when that happens, I will update esbuild's implementation to match the specification. I will not be supporting old versions of the specification.

-   Fix bundled decorators in derived classes ([#​3768](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3768))

    In certain cases, bundling code that uses decorators in a derived class with a class body that references its own class name could previously generate code that crashes at run-time due to an incorrect variable name. This problem has been fixed. Here is an example of code that was compiled incorrectly before this fix:

    ```js
    class Foo extends Object {
      @​(x => x) foo() {
        return Foo
      }
    }
    console.log(new Foo().foo())
    ```

-   Fix `tsconfig.json` files inside symlinked directories ([#​3767](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/3767))

    This release fixes an issue with a scenario involving a `tsconfig.json` file that `extends` another file from within a symlinked directory that uses the `paths` feature. In that case, the implicit `baseURL` value should be based on the real path (i.e. after expanding all symbolic links) instead of the original path. This was already done for other files that esbuild resolves but was not yet done for `tsconfig.json` because it's special-cased (the regular path resolver can't be used because the information inside `tsconfig.json` is involved in path resolution). Note that this fix no longer applies if the `--preserve-symlinks` setting is enabled.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/build): cleanup persistent JS transformer cache on plugin dispose
Issues.Body: Close and allow the persistent JS transformer cache to cleanup open lock files when the Angular compiler plugin is disposed. While this is not strictly necessary, it does help prevent extra cache lock files from being retained after build completion.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): add console note about development server raw file size
Issues.Body: An informational note will now be shown upon development server startup to indicate that the raw file sizes shown in the console do not reflect any of the per-request transformations that may occur within the Vite-based development server. The raw file size and the size shown within the browser may differ as a result of these development workflow based transformations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/build): add console note about development server raw file size" (#27647)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): reduce direct rxjs usage in filter host tree

Issues.Title: ng serve confusing raw size?
Issues.Body: ### Command serve ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was _No response_ ### Description I just saw that ng serve raw size seems to be wrong? In the past, I at least thought they were correct.(When we still used webpack) We see a raw size of 20.22 KB for the main bundle and 33.24 KB for the polyfills. Let's see what the browser says. Not even close. Then I thought, okay, maybe these are estimates for when I eventually build the project. So let's build the project. The main bundle is now 193 KB, but this time at least the 193 KB is correct. Interestingly, the polyfills have the exact same size in ng serve --configuration production as in ng build, at least in the console, but not in the browser. Am i missing something? Am I not reading the numbers correct do they mean something different? They are atleast confusing i would say. Also just standard ng serve numbers are also not the same as in the browser? EDIT: Ok looks like vite is adding allways the sourcemaps inline in serve without it its 20.22kb, And the main size is smaller in serve than in build because of the cached data created. I was pretty confused by it and i can imagine many others are also confused by it especially the behavior atleast to my memory changed compared to webpack. Would it maybe be possible to aknowledge all files in the console? ### Minimal Reproduction ng new testSize cd testSize ng serve --configuration production ### Exception or Error _No response_ ### Your Environment ```text Angular CLI: 17.3.7 Node: 20.12.2 Package Manager: npm 10.5.0 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 17.3.8 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1703.7 @angular-devkit/build-angular 17.3.7 @angular-devkit/core 17.3.7 @angular-devkit/schematics 17.3.7 @angular/cli 17.3.7 @schematics/angular 17.3.7 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.4.5 zone.js 0.14.5 ``` ### Anything else relevant? ItÂ´s an behavior of showing the raw size in the console for ng serve completly different when compared to webpack. Webpack shows for example 318.85kb for the main.js and the browser loads exactly 318.85kb its intuitive and predictable, If we compare it to the current esbuilder/vite solution which adds sourcemaps (Not Angulars fault) and uses the cache on the file system and than shows 20.22kb which is literally impossible and absolutely unintuitive. It would even be better to show no number at this point as it literally can't be evaluated for anything and only will bring confusion to anyone when they compare ng serve with ng build and the ng serve looks smaller in the cli log _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng serve confusing raw size?" (#27645)

Issues.Title: SchematicTestRunner.runExternalSchematic fails with "The encoded data was not valid for encoding utf-8"

### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

### Description

With v18.0.0-rc.1 under some conditions (which  exactly is unclear to me) `SchematicTestRunner.runExternalSchematic` fails with the following error: "The encoded data was not valid for encoding utf-8"


See e.g. https://github.com/daniel-sc/ng-extract-i18n-merge/actions/runs/9091527710/job/24986317152?pr=111

The exact same test runs fine with angular 17: https://github.com/daniel-sc/ng-extract-i18n-merge/actions/runs/9091527710/job/24986316954?pr=111

This is the line were it fails: https://github.com/daniel-sc/ng-extract-i18n-merge/blob/master/schematics/ng-add/index.spec.ts#L45 (unsure why the first invocation succeeds..)

Issues.Title: perf(@angular/build): improve rebuild time for file loader usage with prebundling
Issues.Body: Rebuilds can now use the optimized external package execute path when using the `application` builder's `loader` option if only `file` type loaders are used. The Vite-based development server will now process any `file` type loader usage for third-party file references which removes the need for the build itself to handle the loader processing. This change only optimizes the case where only the `file` loader type is used. If any other loader types are present, the optimized execution path will not be used. Future further improvements may allow for all cases to use the optimized rebuild execution path.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular/build): improve rebuild time for file loader usage with prebundling" (#27642)

Issues.Title: Angular CLI 16+ generates config that fails to inline stylesheet from typekit/Adobe
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, new

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

v15

### Description

I'm unable to get an Adobe/typekit CSS stylesheet to embed using an esbuild-based builder configuration.

The only way to get it to work with esbuild is to disable font optimization via `projects.PROJECT_NAME.architect.build.configurations.production.optimization.fonts = false` in `angular.json`.  Otherwise, I have to revert back to the `browser` builder.  

For now, I'm using the stable `browser` Webpack builder, so that I don't have to muck around with updating configs that may need to be reverted later when we eventually switch to esbuild.  However, the esbuild scripts provide no useful console output or advanced logging to explain _WHY_ it fails, so I have no way to troubleshoot the exact issue.  

Please advise.

### Minimal Reproduction

Given that the build script doesn't provide enough detailed information, I can't reliably determine if the issue resides in the build script itself or if it is a result of being behind our corporate firewall/vpn.  

That being said, here's how I was able to reproduce the issue.

1. Generate a fresh Angular 16 or 17 app using angular CLI
    - CLI v16+ seems to default to the `application` build script
2. `npm install`
3. Check that the production builder is using an esbuild-based script (either `application` or `browser-esbuild`)
4. add an Adobe/typekit css import to your `src/styles.scss`
5. `npm run build`

FYI: This seems to only be an issue with builders using esbuild. The webpack-based `browser` script still works fine, but doesn't actually inline the CSS file; it just passes through the CSS `@import`, verbatim.

### Exception or Error

![Failed to inline external stylesheet](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/assets/545605/d5bd62fc-fea8-45d5-966e-cf873e07a393)

```text
$ npm run build -- --verbose

> ngapp17@0.0.0 build
> ng build --verbose

â ‹ Building...

  polyfills-S3BTP7ME.js  33.2kb

â  Building...

  main-LRVPNULS.js  193.2kb

Application bundle generation failed. [2.388 seconds]

âœ˜ [ERROR] Failed to inline external stylesheet 'https://use.typekit.net/q*****m.css'. [plugin angular-css-inline-fonts-plugin]

    src/styles.scss:2:12:
      2 â”‚ @import url("https://use.typekit.net/q*****m.css");
        â•µ             ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 17.3.7
Node: 18.14.0
Package Manager: npm 9.6.7
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 17.3.8
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1703.7
@angular-devkit/build-angular   17.3.7
@angular-devkit/core            17.3.7
@angular-devkit/schematics      17.3.7
@angular/cli                    17.3.7
@schematics/angular             17.3.7
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.4.5
zone.js                         0.14.5
```


### Anything else relevant?

I've seen old support questions that mention that a VPN may potentially cause problems, but I've not had the chance to verify on a machine without a VPN running.
